text: No, just take the vscode intro thing and you'll see
It's got a lot more baked in and has some features that just aren't possible in sublime
i happily paid for sublime and used it happily for a long time.  vscode just feels better.

one of the biggest perks for me is I love the built in git integration. I’m sure I could have used a sublime plugin, but sublime plugins always felt clunky to me. VS Code ones feel like they’ve got real power to change the interface and functionality
The integrated terminal in VS code is :fire: as well

<@UFBNA9K9A> I took a look but not sure if the end goal I have in mind is possible.Can you provide more insight? Would it be possible to map Sales Stage(A property in Vtiger that can be move to different stages) to Deal stage in HubSpot. When the Sales stage changes in Vtiger for example it would update in HS with the respective changes to deal stage I hope for.. I notice all integrations using the API seemed to use Zapier and I could not find a way as yet in Zapier.....
plug for a vscode extentsion:  `<https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabiospampinato.vscode-projects-plus>`
and i use git-tower so it automatically pulls in my projects

Hey <@UEZJ74UN8> what you are trying to do is definitely do-able. However it may not be do-able via Zapier.  The deal stage value can be changed to via the this endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/update_deal> and you can get what the possible stage values are from this endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pipelines/get_pipelines_for_object_type>.  What you need to do is stand up a piece of middleware that translates between how Vtiger puts information out and how HubSpot expects it. Normally this the role that Zapier would play but it’s possible they haven’t implemented the pipelines API, I haven’t checked

Thanks Zach. Can you elaborate more on this here as I am not sure I fully get what you're saying"What you need to do is stand up a piece of middleware that translates between how Vtiger puts information out and how HubSpot expects it."
Sure things
so HubSpot and Vtiger will have different ways of referring to how a deal has progressed
Some system needs to sit in between the two systems and translate that, this is traditionally called a middleware
To say it another way, you need to create application that can bridge the gap between HubSpot and Vtiger

Hello HubSpot family,

I have a question, after several research I do not find the definitive answer. Is it possible to use scss on a cos HubSpot site? or other technology such as react js

I would like to integrate animations pushed in scss on a future HubSpot site.

Thank you very much for your help!
sorry if it’s a redundant question

yes you can use scss or reactjs, but for preprocessing you have to do it all locally. The experience right now for that isn’t awesome yet. HS devs are actively working to make it easier to dev locally.

In the mean time if you create something with reactjs or vuejs, and need to compile  your code, a great workaround is build in codepen and copy your compiled code over to HS
Also for most of scss you can actually recreate the same functionality using HubL (CSS coded files support HubL)
Jon pretty much nailed it on the head here. Only thing I would say is that HubL will *NOT* allow for SCSS style nesting, which is the primary use case for a lot of devs (me included).
the nesting is definitely one of my favorite features, but becoming less important to me now that I’ve kinda switched to a more BEM like syntax. less nesting going on
Are you not using & selectors? That's why I moved to BEM, so I can write nested and compile clean lol

I definitely do use & selectors
I’m even super eager to move away from using HubL variables in my css files, using custom properties instead.

Soon as IE dies completely I’m going overboard with custom properties

<@U26BLKGE4> can you expand on HubL allowing nesting, are you referring to this type:
```
.class {

    a {
         color:red;
        }
}
```
GAH I meant to write not, not now
corrected
lol ah ok, at first I was like "HOW DID I MISS THIS!" makes sense now
